thread.title: That's a wrap: Standings, playoff pairings for middle school postseason
thread.title_full: That's a wrap: Standings, playoff pairings for middle school postseason

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: That's a wrap: Standings, playoff pairings for middle school postseason
text:
That's a wrap: Standings, playoff pairings for middle school postseason By Staff | Oct 13, 2015 
The Busline League middle school boys, girls and coed soccer regular seasons have drawn to a close, with the playoffs set to kick in. 
The playoffs are slated to begin on Wednesday, Oct. 14, with the championship finals to be at Point Lookout in Northport. 
The coed final will be on Thursday, Oct. 22, the girls final on Monday, Oct. 26 and the boys final on Tuesday, Oct. 27. Each championship game will begin at 3:30 p.m. 
The following is a recap of final standings and upcoming playoff contests (times and dates included when available): 
Coed — Hope 9-0, Lincolnville 8-1-1, Appleton 7-1-1, Jefferson 6-4, Bristol 6-4, St. George 5-5, Vinalhaven 4-4, Camden-Rockport 4-6, South Bristol 2-8, Nobleboro 1-9 and Troy Howard 0-6. 
Boys — Troy Howard 7-0, Camden-Rockport 8th 7-1, Medomak 6-2, Camden-Rockport 7th 3-1-3, Woolwich 3-4-1, Oceanside 2-5-1, Great Salt Bay 2-5-1, Searsport 1-7 and Wiscasset 1-6. 
Girls —Camden-Rockport 7-0, Great Salt Bay 7-1, Troy Howard 5-2-1, Medomak 5-2-1, Oceanside 3-4-1, Wiscasset 3-4, Woolwich 2-5-1, Searsport 1-7 and Boothbay 0-9. 
In coed prelim games, No. 11 Troy Howard will play at No. 6 St. George (Thursday, Oct. 15 at 3:45 p.m.), No. 10 Nobleboro will play at No. 7 Vinalhaven and No. 9 South Bristol will play at No. 8 Camden-Rockport (Wednesday, Oct. 14 at 5 p.m.) 
In a coed quarterfinal, No. 5 Bristol will play at No. 4 Jefferson (Thursday, Oct. 15 at 3:45 p.m.). 
The winner of the Lions/Dragons prelim will play at No. 3 Appleton (Friday, Oct. 16 at 3:45 p.m.), the winner of the Lions/Vikings prelim will play at No. 2 Lincolnville and the winner of the Mariner/Schooner prelim will play at No. 1 Hope (Friday, Oct. 16 at 3:45 p.m.) in quarterfinal contests. 
In a boys prelim game, No. 9 Wiscasset will play at No. 8 Searsport. The winner will play at No. 1 Troy Howard in a quarterfinal game Monday, Oct. 19 at 3:45 p.m. 
In other boys quarterfinal games, No. 7 Great Salt Bay will play at No. 2 CRMS 8th (Monday, Oct. 19 at 3:45 or 5 p.m.), No. 6 Oceanside will play at No. 3 Medomak (Friday, Oct. 16 at 3:30 p.m.) and No. 5 Woolwich will play at No. 4 CRMS 7th (Wednesday, Oct. 14 at 3:45 p.m.). 
In a girls prelim game, No. 9 Boothbay will play at No. 8 Searsport (Wednesday, Oct. 14 at 4:30 p.m.). The winner will play at No. 1 Camden-Rockport in a quarterfinal game on Monday, Oct. 19 at 3:45 or 5 p.m. 
In other girls quarterfinal games, No. 7 Woolwich will play at No. 2 Great Salt Bay, No. 6 Wiscasset will play at No. 3 Troy Howard (Tuesday, Oct. 20 at 3:45 p.m.) and No. 5 Oceanside will play at No. 4 Medomak (Friday, Oct. 16 at 5 p.m.). 
Courier Publications' sports staff can be reached by email at sports@villagesoup.com or by phone at 594-4401.
